newsitem.title: USA: Datawatch sees lower Q2 earnings.
newsitem.headline: Datawatch sees lower Q2 earnings.

text.p: Datawatch Corp said on Wednesday that its profits for the second quarter ended March 31, 1997, will be below earnings of $0.05 a share reported in the year ago period.
The company said its results will be below analysts' expectations, but an exact figure of those expectations was not immediately available.
Revenues for the quarter are expected to be about $8.2 million, which is what the company reported in the first quarter, Datawatch said.
Datawatch, a software maker, said its Monarch unit's revenues have been hurt by stale promotional materials, which have since been "refreshed" for promotions starting this quarter.
The company's sales of Quetzal helped its second quarter earnings and offset the decline of sales in its Monarch product line, Datawatch said.
